org.apache.flink.runtime.execution

Interface ExecutionObserver

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Task

    public interface ExecutionObserver

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void executionStateChanged(ExecutionState newExecutionState, String optionalMessage)
      Called when the execution state of the associated task has changed.
      boolean isCanceled()
      Returns whether the task has been canceled.
      void userThreadFinished(Thread userThread)
      Called when a thread spawn by a user task has finished.
      void userThreadStarted(Thread userThread)
      Called when the user task has started a new thread.

    • Method Detail

      • executionStateChanged

        void executionStateChanged(ExecutionState newExecutionState,
                           String optionalMessage)
        Called when the execution state of the associated task has changed.
        Parameters:
        newExecutionState - the execution state the task has just switched to
        optionalMessage - an optional message providing further information on the state change

      • userThreadStarted

        void userThreadStarted(Thread userThread)
        Called when the user task has started a new thread.
        Parameters:
        userThread - the user thread which has been started

      • userThreadFinished

        void userThreadFinished(Thread userThread)
        Called when a thread spawn by a user task has finished.
        Parameters:
        userThread - the user thread which has finished

      • isCanceled

        boolean isCanceled()
        Returns whether the task has been canceled.
        Returns:
        true if the task has been canceled, false otherwise
